nodes.text: The Mark V14 baggage handler, or repulsorlift baggage cart, was manufactured by Falkenharn Repulsors. It was a collapsible model made from lightweight, composite plastics. it featured rechargeable, long-term use power cells (100 hours when fully charged) and built-in inertial dampeners. It could be pushed manually or controlled with an infrared controller called a "guide stick" that fit in the user's palm and had a 10-meter range. It could hover up to 1.8 meters above the ground and carry 500 kilograms of cargo. The cart was 1.75 meters long, 80 centimeters wide, and 65 centimeters tall. The cart cost 250 credits, while the optional guide stick cost an additional 50 credits.
